title: How to Transfer Config and Keybinds Between 2 accounts

replies.body:
Hello dudes :) This is really easy to set-up. 
STEP 1 : Login to your main account. Go to your League of legends folder, locate League of legends and the folder Config.
Inside this config-folder you find a file named PersistedSettings.json :) 
Copy this file to somewhere you always can find it.. Make a new folder and paste your PersistedSettings.json there.

STEP 2 : Go out of all folders except the new one you made for your PersistedSettings.json.
Login to your other account, go into your League of legends folder again, and once again locate the Config folder.
These files are linked to accounts and not your computer. Take the file from your new folder, paste it into the Config folder and overwrite the current PersistedSettings.json.

Now your settings are the same as in your main account. 
You could upload your file to your phone, email, or a uploading-service of your choice. Next time you are at a friends house and borrow his computer you simply overwrite  the PersistedSettings.json-file he got. But remember to cut out the current so you dont overwrite your friends laptop-settings :) Hope this helped. 

Firstprick

What you say is correct, but i dont know if they changed it or  whatnot.
But once you have copied the PersistedSettings.json over the old one you have to start a game (jsut a custom with no one is fine) so the settings get rememberd.
IT WORKS! Thank you both very much.

Wow this works thanks. my old account had some weird settings inputted to it that i couldnt change example, left clicking the mouse button doesnt do anything but on my new account it shows stats on the left corner on my screen. My old account really has so weird unchangable settings but now i can transfer my new accounts, thanks mate.

Configuration files for the client are found right on top in the **Config** folder, and account specific files are found in **RADS > projects > lol_air_client > releases > 0.0.1.XXX > deploy > preferences**. You can probably simply copy and rename the account named files.

As always, when editing files manually it is a good idea to make a copy of the folder and place it somewhere else so that you can paste it back and overwrite changes that were undesirable.

> [{quoted}](name=Deep Terror Nami,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=RBEp0RFe,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-08-07T15:29:31.394+0000)
>
> Configuration files for the client are found right on top in the **Config** folder, and account specific files are found in **RADS > projects > lol_air_client > releases > 0.0.1.XXX > deploy > preferences**. You can probably simply copy and rename the account named files.
> 
> As always, when editing files manually it is a good idea to make a copy of the folder and place it somewhere else so that you can paste it back and overwrite changes that were undesirable.

It seems to not work ingame, as Im on holiday I couldnt take my PC and  I play on a laptop with a terrible mouse and too scared to play on my main, I got my brother to send me the prefrences of my account but all it did is change the music in the client but was still the same in game (dont have the same settings as on my mains as I got AA move binded to left click) do you know where I could change that? So I could have the same settings on both accounts.

There's no easy way to do this, and because settings are saved to the cloud, it's much easier to simply manually change the settings knowing that they'll sync with the server. I've often seen transferring settings between accounts go wrong and end in some things being broken in the process, so I strongly recommend *against it*.

Let me know if you have any questions.

I changed a lot of things in my setting, like putting attack move on my left click and many more that i don't remember. I tried to change in other accounts in my pc, however there is only one inpu.ini file. So i do not know what to change to have the same in game key bindings in two different accounts. Can you offer any help?
Its a pain, but I bet in the same amount of time you spent looking for solutions/posting here you could have changed all your settings manually :)

Unfortunately, I cannot assist in making any modifications to your input settings that aren't available in-game. Some custom settings can break your inputs, so I definitely recommend *against* such modifications. 

Let me know if that clarified this for you.
